pageTitle: Best Financial Advisors in Federal Way
metaDescription: Find top-rated financial advisors in Federal Way. Expert guidance for retirement planning, wealth management, and investment strategies.

Edward Jones - Financial Advisor: Jackson Miller, CFP®|AAMS®|CRPC™

heroDescription: Federal Way, WA, is a vibrant city known for its diverse community and strong economic base.
landscapeDescription: With a population of 92,734, Federal Way is strategically located between Seattle and Tacoma, fostering economic growth. The city benefits from a mix of retail, healthcare, and education sectors.
uniqueNeeds: Federal Way requires tailored financial strategies to address its unique economic landscape and community needs.
citySpecificRiskAdvice: Federal Way's retail focus poses risks from e-commerce shifts. Housing market trends suggest potential bubble risks. Prepare for flooding and diversify into tech and healthcare sectors.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: According to BEA (2023), Federal Way's economy has shown resilience with a growth rate of 3.2% over the past year, driven by retail and healthcare sectors.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: According to Census (2023), the median income in Federal Way is approximately $75,000, reflecting a diverse economic base and workforce.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Based on BLS (2023), financial advisors in Federal Way are increasingly specializing in retirement planning and real estate investment strategies.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: According to BLS (2024), the cost of living in Federal Way is 10% higher than the national average, driven by housing and transportation costs.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: According to Zillow (2024), the median home price in Federal Way has risen to $500,000, indicating strong demand but potential bubble concerns.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: According to Fortune (2024), Federal Way's business climate is favorable, with a growing number of startups and established businesses in the region.
